intro: Oplismenus walteri, commonly known as Walter's wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a creeping habit with stolons that allow it to spread along the ground. Oplismenus walteri is often found in moist soils and can thrive in partial to full shade.
